DataElement.preferredName: Wechsler Memory Scale - Fourth Edition Logical Memory II Scaled Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the scaled score for the Logical Memory II subtest in the Wechsler Memory Scale, Fourth Edition.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Wechsler Memory Scale - Fourth Edition Logical Memory II Scaled Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The fourth version of the Wechsler Memory Scale that was published in 2009. It is a neuropsychological test designed to measure different memory functions in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 90 years._A subtest of the Wechsler Memory Scale, 4th Edition that assesses narrative memory under a free recall condition. A short story is presented orally. After a delay, the subject is asked to recall the story from memory._Conversion of a raw score on a test to a common scale that allows for a numerical comparison.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The fourth version of the Wechsler Memory Scale that was published in 2009. It is a neuropsychological test designed to measure different memory functions in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 90 years.

Concepts.definition: The fourth version of the Wechsler Memory Scale that was published in 2009. It is a neuropsychological test designed to measure different memory functions in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 90 years.

Property.preferredName: Logical Memory II Subtest (WMS-IV) Scaled Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A subtest of the Wechsler Memory Scale, 4th Edition that assesses narrative memory under a free recall condition. A short story is presented orally. After a delay, the subject is asked to recall the story from memory.:Conversion of a raw score on a test to a common scale that allows for a numerical comparison.

Concepts.definition: A subtest of the Wechsler Memory Scale, 4th Edition that assesses narrative memory under a free recall condition. A short story is presented orally. After a delay, the subject is asked to recall the story from memory.
Conversion of a raw score on a test to a common scale that allows for a numerical comparison.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of a raw score on a test to a common scale in the Wechsler Memory Scale - Fourth Edition.
